prTitle: feat: WebSocket hook and live alert feed component
prBody:
## Summary

Implements task `task-tripwire-cybersecurity-tool-feat-dashboard-ui-2`: WebSocket hook and live alert feed component for the TripWire security dashboard.

### Changes

- **`src/types.ts`** — Add TripWire types: `TripwireAlert`, `TripwireHost`, `WsAlertMessage`, `TripwireType`, `Severity`, `HostStatus`, `WebSocketReadyState`
- **`src/hooks/useWebSocket.ts`** — WebSocket connection hook with exponential-backoff auto-reconnect; bearer token appended as `?token=` query param (browsers cannot send custom WS headers)
- **`src/hooks/useAlerts.ts`** — Live alert accumulation hook; prepends incoming WS alerts newest-first, caps list at `maxAlerts` to prevent unbounded memory growth
- **`src/components/AlertFeed.tsx`** — Virtualized alert list using `react-window` `FixedSizeList`; DOM node count stays constant regardless of alert volume; severity colour-coding and keyboard accessibility
- **`src/pages/TripwireDashboardPage.tsx`** — Top-level `/dashboard` route with connection status badge, alert count toolbar, and click-to-expand alert detail modal
- **`src/App.tsx`** — Add `/dashboard` route
- **`package.json`** — Add `react-window@1.8.10` and `@types/react-window`

### Tests (51 new, all passing)

- `useWebSocket.test.ts` (20 tests)
- `useAlerts.test.ts` (13 tests)
- `AlertFeed.test.tsx` (18 tests)

### Acceptance criteria

- useWebSocket reconnects automatically on disconnect with exponential backoff
- Bearer token applied in the upgrade request via `?token=` query param
- New alerts appear in the feed via prepend — no full list re-render needed
- AlertFeed virtualizes rows via react-window so DOM node count stays constant

Closes #257
